docs.text: albert brooks saves the day , just in the nick of time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with a very poor summer for movies , brooks is just what audiences were looking for to cheer them up , and does so in a positive way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while this may not be his finest work , " the muse " still shakes up some delightful humor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in albert brook's latest comedy , he tells a story of a troubled screenwriter ( brooks ) who's losing his edge , as his business partners say .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in desperation , he goes to see his friend jack ( jeff bridges ) , who has been a very successful screenwriter in the past .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he asks jack for some help , and recieves word of a real life muse , that has helped him and many other directors throughout their career .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so brooks seeks the muse named sarah ( sharon stone ) , and is suckered into buying her expensive , food etc . as a sort of payment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the real punch line however , doesn't come until the end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it really makes you wonder , how screenwriters really get their ideas , could it simply be from a friend or a bum in the street ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the idea itself is provoking and brooks does it in a hilarious manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: speaking of brooks , he was absolutely hysterical as a screenwriter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every time he graces the screen , i can't help but start laughing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: albert has a very unique sense of humor that makes him a very likeable character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the real problem with the film lies with sharon stone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she wasn't likeable at all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: brooks had the right idea with her occupation , but she never pulled through .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a way , she drained energy from the once funny atmosphere and left it bleak .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: luckily brooks could clean up the mess , and cover for stone's mishap .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was a shame that the film went slightly downhill after her appearance , because " the muse " had the potential to a be a very authentic comedy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on a brighter note , andie macdowell was also charming as brook's wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is always a nice addition as a supporting actress , because she has that charisma that seems to complete the atmosphere to any film she's in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the funniest moments in " the muse " in my opinion were the cameos by james cameron and martin scorsese .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i mean imagine , brooks seeing these big named directors in his back yard seeking sharon stone for advice , like it was something out of the ordinary .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was just plain hilarious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it just adds to the satire joke , of how directors get ideas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: brilliant move by brooks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as i mentioned before , the film is a satire much like it's proceeder bowfinger , which came out a few weeks before .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike bowfinger , this is not a mean spirited film that's desperate for jokes , it's rather a witty and humorous look at hollywood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " bowfinger " had it's moments , but had quite a few problems that were never worked out , but " the muse " still managed to keep the laughs despite a bit of a detour .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: by the end of the film , you're glad to see a good hearty comedy come out of it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for once i'm not fully disappointed , because the film didn't slow down , it kept moving , even with some flaws .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: thumbs up to brooks for his brave effort .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i think he'll still manage to keep his edge around well into the future .
docs.label: positive
